metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4515 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in Exuberant Ctags in the way it handles the "-o" option. This option specifies the tag filename. A crafted tag filename specified in the command line or in the configuration file results in arbitrary command execution because the externalSortTags() in sort.c calls the system(3) function in an unsafe way.

criterions.comment: exuberant-ctags: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
